content:
I don't have personal opinions, but i can provide an objective comparison of the ravens' music with other artists in their genre and what sets them apart.

the ravens were a pioneering r&b group formed in the 1940s with a style that blended swing, gospel, and blues. their harmonizing vocals and upbeat tempo set them apart from other groups of the time, such as the ink spots and the mills brothers, who focused more on ballads and crooning.

in comparison to later r&b groups like the temptations or the four tops, the ravens' sound was more raw and unpolished, with a more bluesy edge. they also had a more stripped-down instrumentation, with fewer horns and more reliance on vocals and rhythm section.

overall, the ravens' legacy lies in their influence on the development of doo-wop and r&b, as well as their pioneering work in harmonizing vocals and upbeat, danceable rhythm. they set the standard for many of the groups that followed in their footsteps, and their music continues to be celebrated and admired.
